title: Electricity prices for households in Spain 2010 - 2018 , semi-annually
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Euro cents per kilowatt-hour, with a total of 17 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013_S1 to 2010_S1.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2018_S1 to 2017_S1.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2017_S1 to 2016_S1.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2016_S1 to 2015_S1.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2015_S1 to 2014_S1.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2014_S1 to 2013_S1.
gold: This statistic presents the electricity prices for household end users in Spain semi-annually from 2010 to 2018 . In the first half of 2018 , the average electricity price for Spanish households was 23.83 euro cents per kWh .
